name: Cosmic Guerilla
description:
Cosmic Guerilla is an imitation and a non official version of the arcade Cosmic Guerilla. Similarly, the player controls a spaceship and has to defend his stationary fleet from being destroyed. The fleet is located on the centre of the screen and is aligned vertically, surrounded laterally by two vertical matrices of shields.

There are also present many sets of attackers which are aligned vertically and distributed on both right and left sides of the matrices of shields which are protecting the fleet. These attackers won't fire at none of the player's ships nor at the spaceship the player is commanding, instead they'll try to horizontally take the shields one by one until a spaceship is finally exposed. If a spaceship is taken by an alien, the player looses one life. If the player selects the "Alien Ships" option at the "Game Option" menu, sporadically a flying disc will fly at a very low altitude constantly bombarding the ground. If the playable spaceship is exposed to this bombardment one of the fleet's is immediately lost.

shot.caption: Set 1 - Destroying the 1st alien. (You shall not take a shield!) (I'm innocent man...!)
Set 1 - Alien creature is stealing a shield... or... (two aliens are going to start playing badminton...?)
Set 1 - Flying Disc fulminating the spaceship with rays... not for long though (and on the backstage, several aliens are stealing many shields)
Set 1 - for the lesser experienced observer, this frame looks almost identical as the previous, but take a deep look at the right upper corner. The bast... is stealing one of your ships!!
Set 1 - Now this one also looks identical as the previous ones looked alike but take a deep look at what happened to your ship after one of the backup ships was stolen.
Set 2 - These ones look more sad than the previous.
Set 2 - Extraordinary caption of advancing to the next level.
Set 3 - These ones are bullies for sure. Look at their proboscises and tell me if they don't look Gamorreans?
Set 3 - You last ship (this is complicated to understand because in fact the ship the player is playing is somehow fused with the one the gamorrean is stealing) Weird isn't it?
Greasing Moby Games again. Doesn't hurt anyone to grease two times in a row. My humble opinion of course.
